content.description: Climb up sidepulls and somewhat sharp pockets to reach a good rest on two wrapper monos. Make a few moves on crimps as thin as a pedophiles moustache to reach deeper pockets leading to the chains. Not the best climb at the Remuda.
content.location: On the slabby panel to the left of Court and Spark. This climb starts right of Crooked Darlin and goes straight up.

content.description: This route starts underneath a flake / crack feature and heads up the bulge. The route is generally dirty and the rock is of poor quality - I would not recommend climbing it. I have no details on this route and am mainly adding it so nobody else is confused and thinks it is Celestial Siren. This route felt rather hard and is likely in the ~5.13 realm.
content.location: Immediately right of "Dun Roamin," this route starts up underneath a flake / crack feature and goes up the bulge above.

content.description: Balance your way up the tricky rounded arete.
content.location: Waffles Spire - The small detached wall between Burnt Beans and Coffee and Court and Spark. This is the leftmost route that climbs the arete.

content.description:
Stick clip high first bolt. Bouldery start to delicate slab ride to chains. If using flake to right, be ginger. From the flake, continue up to the ledge and onto the arete and up.

P1: 6 bolts + anchors

P2: 4 bolts + anchors

Can be climbed in a single pitch.
content.protection:
6 bolts + anchor

+ 4 bolts + anchor

When cleaning, lower

leader towards first set of anchors, clip leader rope into one of the carabiner at fixed anchor as a directional for cleaning draws on the way down.
content.location: To the left of “court and spark (5.12b)” and right of “buck a move (5.13a)”

content.description: Get your mono warmed up and fire up this beautiful belly.
content.location: Middle route down from Court and Spark

content.description: Excellent long varied climb! Cool technically crux just few bolts up. Be careful exiting small overhang to the anchor, flakes on left are loose.
content.location: Downhill and left of two log steps, starts in inside corner/crack just left of low overhanging bulge (Deuces Wild 11b).

content.description: Crux from ground passing 2nd bolt then straight forward low angle climbing out right to shared anchor with Meteetsee-Pete.
content.location: Start from large rock just above two log steps that head down to left side of B17 wall.

climbs.name: Meteetsee Pete
climbs.fa: Metisse Weaver and Sam Lightner Jr

content.description: Do you have a very young climber in your crew? This route was bolted to be a first lead for kids. The first ascentionist did it as his first ever lead. He was 9. Enjoy the route.
content.location: The low angle arete 50 meters uphill from Court and Spark (just before where the trail goes over a large boulder). The Wall to the left is the B-17 Wall. Fifty feet uphill from this line are the Good, Bad, and Ugly climbs.

content.description: Tan hangers, stick clip first bolt. Shares start with ‘Reluctant Dragon” then follow crack to slab to dihedral and roof, exit onto ledge and anchor.
content.protection: 8 bolts to rappel rings, optional to use first two bolts of “Reluctant Dragon”
content.location: Start above a large Boulder that is just above two large log steps that continue down trail. Look for obvious dihedral and roof above.

content.description: Three bolts of hard slab climbing lead to a rest. From here, climb fun, steep pockets to a high crux. An alternate start goes up the right side of the slab.
content.location: Right-most route on the pillar left of "Buck a Move".

content.description: A boulder problem start to a rest in the scoop before launching up the seam using pockets and a hold or two in the seam. Finish with pockets and the hanging flake and mantle onto the ledge to clip the anchors.
content.location: Next route right of Court N Spark.

content.description: Locate the crack immediately climbers left of Celestial Siren.  Enjoyable crack to a good stance and then into a short crux (guide lists 11d... seems a touch easier).  Last couple of bolts make up the business.  Shares an anchor with Celestial
content.location: Left of Celestial Siren.  Obvious finger crack

content.description: Steep from the start on good holds to thin slab top.
content.location: Right of an inside corner/crack and Shady Lady. Downhill and left of two log steps.

content.description: Great pocket sequence and a couple variations through the crux at mid-height will keep you on your toes. Continues way up to the top of the wall.
content.location: Waffles Spire - The small detached wall between Burnt Beans and Coffee and Court and Spark. This is the second route from the left.

content.description: Climb up and follow the bolts, but head high before crossing over Pedophile Moustache, 11c.  Traverse right and then straight up to a balancy clip.   Slab to finish.
content.location: On the dark gray wall just to the left of The Devil's Herd, 12a and Ghost Rider, 11d.   Pedophile Moustache is the direct line here.

content.description: Powerful start to some pocket climbing, with a thinner crux up high.
content.location: Farthest left route at the Lower Remuda.  Left of Silverbelly.

content.description: A few slab moves put you under the white prow.  Decipher the pockets and mantle onto the ledge.
content.location: When the trail dumps you in front of the wall, you are looking at Court and Spark

content.description: High crux
content.location: to the right of courage.

content.description: Slab.Right Mono
content.location: Two routes to the right of burnt beans

content.description: A really great moderate that climbs to a cools summit. It is well bolted for a 5.8 leader and is heavily featured. Sign the summit register!
content.protection: 6 Bolts to chains on the top of the spire
content.location: In the Court and Spark area, this is the bolted dark slab on the Waffles Spire before you take the trail down towards Silverbelly.

content.description: Big pulls on good pockets to upper crux bulge. Mantle ledge and clip anchors. Continuous good climbing.
content.location: Uphill 100 feet from court and spark. Second climb to the right on the wall. Vertical climbing to bulge.

content.description: Awesome pocket pulling leads to thin mono.  Pull it down and enjoy
content.location: Follow trail past court and spark to find three routes.  Burnt beans is the right most

content.description:
Short and savage, Buck a Move follows a line of pockets up a pretty bulge and ends with an easier slab.

Step up on some cheater stones, grab a good starting hold and get ready for business.  A hard sidepull or very tight mono move gains some better holds.  Then another very skinny mono gets you to better holds below the crux.  With awkwardly high feet, get crossed up on some bad two-finger pockets and lunge for a good pocket.  Rest up, make a very long move to establish on the slab and tech you way to the chains.

This route is much better than the 0 star quality rating the guidebook indicates.  FYI, the monos on this route are very small.  I couldn't use the first mono, and had to use my ring finger for the second mono.
content.location: 30 feet left of Court N Spark.

content.description: And now for something completely different! Climb the steep crack using jams and holds up to a two bolt anchor. Crack climbers may find the grade to be soft, while pure sport enthusiasts may find themselves a little big for their britches! finger locks, pockets, and hand jams combine with the steep angle for a wild little ride! Do it, you won't!
content.location: Crack feature directly left of Silverbelly

content.description: Sequential two-finger pockets run out at three-quarter height. Low angle slabby edging leads to a jug and pocket bulge before the anchors.
content.location: Waffles Spire - The small detached wall between Burnt Beans and Coffee and Court and Spark. This is the third route in from the left. Climb through a low bulge to the right of a small tree and flake.

content.description: Similar in nature to Bearly There (to the left). Climb a featured face to a short slabby section before a bulge. Sign the summit register!
content.location: Waffles Spire - The small detached wall between Burnt Beans and Coffee and Court and Spark. This is the rightmost route, or the fourth from the left.
